description.value: When this encounter begins, the fire erupts in a ring that encircles the entire stage, as shown by the dotted outline on the map. The stage fire then rolls initiative.

details.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:27] to extinguish two adjacent squares of fire (with a critical success extinguishing four adjacent squares); any water spell (such as from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Create Water] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Hydraulic Push]) cast at the fire extinguishes two squares automatically, or [[/r 2d4 #Squares]] adjacent squares if the caster of the spell achieves a DC 30 result with a spell attack roll; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Quench] instantly extinguishes all fire within its 20â€‘foot burst.
details.routine:
On its turn, the stage fire expands inward and outward by 5 feet, filling all adjacent squares with fire. Creatures within these squares take @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true]), as do any creatures that enter a burning square. This fire damage can be inflicted on a creature only once per turn.

In addition, a creature that ends its turn in a burning square takes @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true]); on a failed save, that creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage.
